newsitem.title: GERMANY: Glunz 96 pretax profit minus 180 mln DM.
newsitem.headline: Glunz 96 pretax profit minus 180 mln DM.

text.p: German building materials producer Glunz AG reported on Wednesday it lost 180 million marks in 1996 pretax profit as a result of falling sales and a significant write-off in France.
The setback in pretax profit included an 84 million mark charge for restructuring its French venture, Glunz France S.A.
At the same time, group sales fell nine percent to 1.9 billion marks as the German construction industry remained depressed. Sales in the German parent fell 11 percent to 537 million marks.
The company said it expected restructuring throughout the group to lead to a distinctly smaller loss in 1997 and positive results in 1998.
Glunz, which makes chipboard and fibreboard, last year accepted 50 million marks restructuring aid from the state of Lower Saxony.
